intro: Platystemon hispidulus, commonly known as the hairy platystemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
